column3: Cultural gismu replacement lujvo for communities: From gismu {cecmu} and {srana}

column2: $x_1$ is $x_2$ percent of $x_3$ in dimension/aspect $x_3$.
$l1$=$c1$ is $l2$ centiliter(s)/centilitre(s) [metric unit] in volume (default is 1) by standard $l3$
$d1$ is $d2$ full (centi)milidays (hundred-thousandth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 (centi)miliday) by standard $d3$; d1 is a metric second.
column3: For use with metric time system. (It is not proper in the standard metric system to combine prefixes, but lojban's grouping rules allow for it.)

column2: $m_1$=$c_1$ is $m_2$=$c_2$ centimeter(s) / hundredth(s) of a meter [metric unit] in length (default 1) measured in direction $m_3$=$c_3$ by standard $x_4$=$m_3$.
$d_1$ is $d_2$ full centidays (hundredth of a day unit) in duration (default is 1 centiday) by standard $d_3$
column3: For use with metric time system.

column2: $m_1$=$c_1$ is the dawn of day $m_2$=$c_2$ at location $m_3$=$c_3$.
$ca_1$ is matutinal/active during the pre-dawn/early morning $ce_1$=$m_1$.
$s_1$ (mass) is a breakfast composed of dishes including $s_2$.
$r_1$ blesses/sanctifies $c_1$ in the name of person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$ under conditions $r_3$.
$s_1$ worships $s_2$=$c_1$, which is holy/sacred to $c_2$=$r_3$, with ritual $r_1$ having form/rules $r_4$.
$x_1$ is an expanse of sacred/sanctified/hallowed/holy/consecrated/blessed/venerable land according to community $x_2$ and which is located at $x_3$
$cu_1$=$ce_1$ is a holy book containing work $cu_2$ by (presumed) author $cu_3$ for audience $cu_4$=$ce_2$ preserved in medium $cu_5$.
$s_1$ is hieralogy/science of/about sacreds/sacredness $c_1$=$s_2$ based on methodology $s_3$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is a holy site to person/people/culture/religion/cult/group $c_2$.
$x_1$ is saintly/holy by moral standard/religion $x_2$
$cmene_1$ is a Divine Name of $cevni_1$=$cmene_2$ as known by $cevni_2$=$cmene_3$ which is associated with $cevni_3$; $cmene_1$ is a name of god.
$b_1$ is entirely in the future of $b_2$; $b_1$ begins after $b_2$.
$g_1$ notices $g_2$ by means $g_3$ under condition $g_4$=$c_1$.
$x_1$=$g_1$ (person/agent) initiates/begins/starts/causes the beginning of $x_2$=$c_1$ (state/event/process).
$p_1$ is preliminary to $c_1$=$p_2$'s beginning.
$r_1$ is/are the ritual/proceedings for starting/commencing $c_1$[event/state/process] by community $r_2$ with rules $c_4$.
$s_1$ realizes $s_2$ under condition $c_1$.
$s_1$ powers up $s_2$ for function $s_3$=$c_1$.
$x_1$ is the preamble/introduction to $x_2$
$x_1$ sits down on $x_2$.
column3: Cf. {co'a}, {cfari}, {zutse}, {nitytse}, {tsebi'o}. Simple {zutse} refers to the act of sitting, whereas cfatse means the act of beginning to sit.

column2: $x_1$ finds fault/flaw $x_2$ in $x_3$ (object/action), of which the flaw causes $x_4$
$x_1$ debugs $x_2$
$x_1$ finds fault/flaw $x_2$ in actions $x_3$ causing $x_4$; $x_1$ criticizes with critics $x_2$ action $x_3$
$t_1$=$c_1$ is a wedge (tool) of material $c_2$.
$v_1$ is a crowbar/nutpick for doing $v_2$, with fulcrum $v_3$, arm $v_4$, and pointed end $c_1$
column3: Any tool with a wedge on the end of a lever, normally with the fulcrum close to the wedge.

column2: $s_1$ diagnoses/proof-reads/searches/tests/debugs for flaw/property $c_1$=$s_2$ in $c_2$=$s_3$  causing $c_3$
$x_1$ is a "bug-list" / list of discovered flaws in $x_2$
$j_1$ is a writing desk of material $j_2$, supported by legs/base/pedestal $j_3$, used by writer $c_1$.
$f_1$=$c_1$ writes/authors $f_2$=$c_2$ for purpose $f_3$ from existing elements/ideas $f_4$.
$s_1$=$c_2$ is a secretary to $s_2$.
$t_1$ is a font/writing style used by $c_1$ to write $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with implement $c_4$ under conditions $t_3$.
column3: {tadji} isn't exactly the right word. Deprecated in favor of {ci'artai}.

column2: $t_1$ is a font/writing style used by $c_1$ to write $c_2$ on medium $c_3$ with implement $c_4$.
$cu_1$=$ci_1$ expresses in writing $cu_2$=$ci_2$ for audience $cu_3$ using display/storage medium $ci_3$ with writing implement $ci_4$.
$x_1$ commits typo/writing error $x_2$
$x_1$ is a Wednesday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$c_1$ is trigonometry of triangle $j_1$.
$t_1$ is a triangle.
$d_1$ is a triangle (musical instrument).
$g_1$ is $g_2$ yard/yards (length unit).
$x_1$ is March/the third month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is March/the third month of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$j_1$ has the rank of Major/Lieutenant Commander/Squadron Leader (equivalent of NATO OF-3) in military unit /organization $j_2$.
column3: Cf. {ci}, {moi}, {jatna}, {jemja'a}, {vairsoi}, {vonmoija'a}, {relmoija'a}.  Based on STANAG 2116: NATO Codes for Grades of Military Personnel.

column2: $xa_1$=$d_1$ is the middle finger of hand $xa_2$=$d_2$ attached to body $d_3$.
$x_1$ is a 3-dimensional vector with coordinates $x_2$, $x_3$ and $x_4$.
$x_1$ is a Wednesday evening of week $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$x_1$ is the volume (3-dimensional space) occupied by $x_2$
$x_1$=$v_1$=$f_1$ is a stage 3 fu'ivla meaning $x_2$=$v_2$, based on word $x_3$=$f_2$ in language $x_4$.
column3: 'stage 3 fu'ivla' is a term specific to Lojban and described in 'The Complete Lojban Language', chapter 4, section 7. The definition is similar to that of {fu'ivla}, but with the x3 place of {fu'ivla} omitted. x1 is assumed to be a word in Lojban as the concept doesn't make much sense for other languages. See also {pavyfu'ivla} - 'stage 1 fu'ivla', {relfu'ivla} - 'stage 2 fu'ivla' and {vonfu'ivla} - 'stage 4 fu'ivla'

column2: $x_1$ (sound, text) is a triphthong.
$p_1$ is an upper secondary education diploma entitling $p_2$ to entitlement/privilege $p_3$ (event/state) from school/institute/academy $c_1$ teaching subject(s) $c_3$.
column3: Third level of International Standard Classification of Education (ISCED).

column2: $x_1$=$kr_3$ is a three-way intersection of roads $x_2$=$kr_1$=$kl_1$.
$x_{1}$ is a quantity of Citrus trifoliata [fruit/tree, etc.] of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$p_1$ is the third closest planet revolving around $p_2$, with planetary characteristics $p_3$, orbital parameters $p_4$.
$t_2$ is three-legged with legs $t_1$.
$v_1$ is a three-syllable word meaning $v_2$ in language $v_3$=$s_2$ with syllables $s_1$.
$x_1$ is three-legged.
$m_1$ is a tricycle (propelled, three-wheeled vehicle) carrying $m_2$ on surface $m_3$, propelled by $m_4$
column3: Explicitly implies a propelled vehicle. Parallels {relxilma'e}. {cibyselxi'u} merely refers to a "device".

column2: $f_1$ is an uncultivated field of material $f_2$.
$x_1$ is a wildcat
$x_1$ is sky-blue [color adjective].
$x_1$ is Thursday of week $x_2$ on calendar $x_3$.
$j_1$ is a turquoise (gem/polished stone) of type $j_2$ from source material $j_3$.
$k_1$ is/contains/is made from turquoise of type $k_2$, mined from location/lode/mine $k_3$.
$x_1$ is aqua [color adjective].
$x_1$ is the abstract color cyan
column3: The gismu {cicna} refers to objects which are cyan, but not the color cyan itself.  This lujvo serves the latter purpose.  See also {skari} {zilska}

column2: $x_1$ is a wild apple/crab apple of species/strain/cultivar $x_2$
$c_1$=$p_1$ is a savage/wild person.
$f_1$ is a jungle
$cr_1$ wildcrafts $cr_2$ from $cr_3$=$ci_1$.
$r_1$ is a hare of species $r_2$.
$x_1$ is wild rice of species/variety $x_2$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ is a weed of species $s_2$.
$f_{1}$ is a brush/shrubland [field of wild plants] with predominant plant species/cultivar $s_{2}$.
column3: Not neccessarily limited to bushes, this can refer to any expanses of land with wild plants. Cf {spafoi} (without the restriction to wild plants), {foldi}.

column2: $v_1$ weeds out plants $s_1$=$c_1$ of species $s_2$ from $v_3$ with/leaving result/remnant/remainder $v_4$.
$ca_1$=$ci_3$ crawls on surface $ca_2$.
column3: Cf. {cidni}, {cadzu}, {cidydzu}, {cidykla}, {reskla}. Similar to walking but without standing on feet.

column2: $t_1$ kneels on surface $t_2$ on limb $c_2$=$x_3$ of body $c_3$=$x_4$.
$k_1$ plays game $k_2$=$c_1$ governed by rules $c_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual) $c_3$.
$ke_1$=$kl_1$ has score $kl_2$ in game $ke_2$=$c_1$ governed by rules $c_2$ interrelating game parts (physical or conceptual) $c_3$.
column3: klani3 (the scale of the score) is implicit in the rules of the game.

column2: $x_1$=$n_1$ is a revolution that a system $x_2$=$b_1$=$c_1$ becomes another system $x_3$=$b_2$=$c_1$ under conditions $x_3$=$b_3$.
$s_1$ installs $s_2$ into system $s_3$=$c_1$.
column3: The installation need not be physical. It can be software installation, for example. (cf. {ci'ertolse'a}, {ci'erse'atci}, {ci'ertolse'atci})

column2: $t_1$ is an installer for installing $s_2$ into system $s_3$=$c_1$.
$s_1$ uninstalls $s_2$ from system $s_3$=$c_1$.
$t_1$ is an uninstaller for uninstalling $s_2$ from system $s_3$=$c_1$.

$k_1$=$t_1$ is/are using baby talk/caretaker speech/infant-directed speech (IDS)/child-directed speech (CDS)/parentese to $c_1$=$k_2$=$t_2$ (default: infant/baby) about subject $t_3$ in language $t_4$.
$c_1$=$s_1$ is a maggot/fly larva of species/breed $c_2$=$s_2$
$x_1$ is a caterpillar (larva of butterfly or moth - not sawfly) of species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a sapling of species/cultivar $x_2$
$x_1$ is a flower bud of plant/species $x_2$.
$b_1$=$c_1$ is/are (a) calf/calves [infant cattle/beef-producer/bovine] of species/breed $b_2$=$c_2$.
column3: Young cattle of both sexes are called calves until they are weaned.

column2: $d_1$=$c_1$ is a duckling of species/breed $d_2$=$c_2$.
$l_1$ is a children's story about plot/subject/moral $l_2$ by storyteller $l_3$ to audience $l_4$.
$x_1$ [loves/takes great, passionate interest in] $x_2$
column3: e.g. he *loves* football, I *love* Lojban. From {cinri} + {prami}. See {entuzi}

column2: $c_1$=$z_1$ is more interesting than $z_2$ to $c_2$ in amount $z_4$.
$s_1$=$c_1$ daydreams about $s_2$; $s_2$ is a daydream of $s_1$=$c_1$.
$b_1$=$c_1$ awakens/becomes awake under conditions $b_3$.
$g_1$ (person/agent) wakes up $c_1$.
$x_1$ is an alarm clock measuring time units $x_{2}$ to precision $x_{3}$ with timing mechanism/method $x_{4}$.
$g_1$ ties $j_1$ to $j_2$ with $c_1$.
$c_1$ is the wet season of year/years $c_3$.
$d_1$=$c_1$ is a quantityof/contains/is made of mud from source $d_2$ of composition $d_3$, moist due to liquid $c_2$.
$x_{1}$ is a cloud with cloud material-moisture $x_{2}$ with cloudy $x_{3}$ with cloud base [elevation] $x_{4}$.
$x_1$ has $x_2$ (li) number of dimensions
$t_1$ is a wet suit for wearing by $t_2$=$j_1$=$c_1$ in liquid $j_2$=$c_2$.
$l_1$ is an implicitly metaphorical lujvo with meaning $l_2$ and arguments $l_3$ built from metaphor $l_4$.
column3: Used to refer to metaphorical lujvo that do not contain any -pev- rafsi (for “{pe'a}”). The word “{cimjvo}” is itself an example of cimjvo. Synonym of “cimjvo” with explicit metaphor: “{pevycimjvo}”.

column2: $x_{1}$ (mass) is a font interrelated by rules or relations $x_{2}$ among components $x_{3}$ (full set) displaying $x_{4}$ (property of $x_{1}$).
I declare that the symbol/expression $x_1$ (quote) henceforth has predicate $x_2$ as its meaning.
$x_1$ is a polo shirt of material $x_2$.
column3: A T-shaped shirt with a collar, typically a two- or three-button placket, and an optional pocket. Cf. {creka}.

column2: $x_1$ is a T-shirt made from material $x_2$.
$x_1$ is $x_2$ shekels/tolas in mass by standard $x_3$
column3: Both are about 11.7 g (the shekel being more variable), and both are derived from a word meaning "weigh".

column2: $x_1$ (knowledge) is science about subject matter $x_2$ based on the Scientific Method $x_3$
column3: Specific to the Scientific Method. Cf. {saske}.

column2: members of $x_1$ (ordered set with two members) are related to each other as members of $x_2$ (ordered set with two members) or as members of $x_3$ (ordered set with two members) ... (infinite number of places)
$x_1$ is a/the kidney [body-part] of $x_2$
$x_1$ is a cornflower of type $x_2$
$x_1$ is in the center of $x_2$
column3: A central subset (of a set or territory). Use {midju} for center point, {kernelo} for nucleus.

column2: $x_1$ is a centrifuge/centrifugal machine
$x_1$ is a hornet/yellowjacket of genus/species $x_2$
$x1$ pertains to Acheulean technological industry/culture/know-how of period and location (specifics) $x2$ in properties $x3$.
column3: The Acheulean industry spanned so much time and was organized by successive waves of human migrations into various geographical regions, each group introducing its own unique small variations on common Acheulean stone technology themes, that x2 is of particular importance.

column2: $x_1$ is blank/has no writing on it
$x_{1}$ reflects the Xia culture/nationality in aspect $x_{2}$.
$x_1$ is myrrh from tree species $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a/the triforce/Power of the Gods/Golden Triangle consisting of magic triangles $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a deep-fried choux pastry/beignet/fritter of variety/with ingredients $x_2$
$x_1$ is a bento(food).
$x_1$ is biko Philippine sweet rice cake of ingredients/contents $x_2$ of variety/type $x_3$
$x_1$ is a bingsu/bingsoo (Korean), a Korean ice dessert, with ingredients/style $x_2$
$x_1$ is Philippine "Brazo de Mercedes" dessert of type/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a burrito/Mexican dish of ingredients wrapped in a tortilla including ingredients $x_2$.
$x_1$ is dinuguan, Philippine pig's blood stew in style/with ingredients $x_2$
$x_1$ is fufu, African dough-like food, of type/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a curry (Indian spiced dish/food/sauce) of composition/made from $x_2$.
$x_1$ is a quantity of couscous of ingredients including $x_2$
$x_1$ is a roasted pig of variety/type $x_2$
$x_1$ is macapuno, coconut sport, of variety/type $x_2$
$x_1$ is Japanese manjū with ingredients/contents $x_2$ of variety/type $x_3$
column3: Japanese manjū (饅頭, まんじゅう)

column2: $x_1$ is a pizza with topping/ingredients $x_2$.
$x_1$ is sapin-sapin, Philippine layered multicolored glutinous rice and coconut dessert in style/of type/with ingredients $x_2$
$x_1$ is a quantity of spaghetti (long, thin cylindrical pasta)
column3: Synonyms: {djarspageti}, {spageti}. This word is in Jbovlaste based on its use in CLL.

column2: $x_1$ is Philippine espasol dessert of type/variety $x_2$
$x_1$ is a quantity of sushi consisting of rice $x_2$ and ingredients $x_3$
$c_1$ is surströmming (fermented Baltic herring).
$x_1$ is a taco.
$x_1$ is chè ba màu, Vietnamese three-color dessert, of ingredients/contents $x_2$, of type/variety $x_3$
$x_1$ is a quantity of chili con carne.
$x_1$ is Philippine halúhalò (halò-halò), colored ice dessert, of ingredients/contents $x_2$, of type/variety $x_3$
$x_1$ is chometz.
$x_1$ is a hotdog
$x_1$ plays a mancala game $x_2$ with/organized by rules $x_3$ which interrelate game parts (physical or conceptual) $x_4$.
column3: Mancala is a family of games, not a specific version/realization thereof.

column2: $x_1$ is a quantity of propane
March.
name: Chicago
transfnite cardinal beth
$x_1$ is a/the triforce/Power of the Gods/Golden Triangle consisting of magic triangles $x_2$.
number: uncountably infinite of some sort or infinite in the sense of satisfying the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis.
column3: An infinite cardinality which is not countable (aleph-0); if the Generalized Continuum Hypothesis (GCH) is rejected, meaning that the only infinite cardinalities are those of aleph-n form (for nonnegative integer n), then this word would incorporate all uncountable infinities (aleph-m for any strictly positive integer m); else, it incorporates those and any infinity which is strictly larger than aleph-0.

column2: Digit string: aleph-nought, aleph-0, the cardinality of the natural (alternatively: integer) numbers
tense interval modifier: countably infinitely many times; objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
column3: Not necessarily discrete or unbounded in time, nor (eventually or otherwise) infinitely frequent; as a set of Lebesgue measure 0, it is definitely not "always" ({roroi}) in most contexts. For a less specific form of "infinitely many times", use "{ci'iroi}". For the R type of uncountably infinitely many times, use "{ci'iparoi}".

column2: $x_1$ is "curiouser and curiouser" / strange / weird / deviant / bizarre / odd to $x_2$ in property $x_3$ (ka).
column3: Playful synonym of {cizra}, as uttered by Alice in the Lojban translation of Alice in Wonderland. (In the original English, she says "curiouser and curiouser!")

column2: Szymborska
transfinite ordinal little-omega; if followed by a number, it denotes the ordinal which is little-omega subscripted therewith in English notation
transfinite ordinal little-epsilon; if followed by a number, in English notation, the following number would be denoted by a subscript
tense interval modifier: continuum (R) type infinitely many time(s); objectively quantified tense; defaults as time tense.
column3: Strictly more times than "{ci'inoroi}" but not necessarily equivalent to "{roroi}" (for example, this word's reference set of times includes bounded intervals (not treated as "{paroi}"/single discrete events) and intervals with gaps). More specific than "{ci'iroi}".
column5: continuumly infinitely many times;uncountably infinitely many times

column2: tense interval modifier: occurs infinite times, eternally; objective tense; defaults as time.
number/quantity: 3,000 expressed with comma.
propane
$c_1$ is surströmming (fermented Baltic herring).
quantifier selbri: convert 3 to cardinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is a set with the trio of members $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ (agent) kisses/busses $x_{2}$ at locus $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is an oak, a type of tree of species/strain $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a lion/[lioness] of species/breed $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is a wrinkle/crease/fold [shape/form] in $x_{2}$.
$x_{1}$ is an insect/arthropod of species $x_{2}$; [bug/beetle].
$x_1$ is infinitely recursively related to $x_2$ by applying infinite levels of recursion to predicate relation $x_3$ (ka with two ce'u)
$c_2$ is an infinite set with members $c_1$ (incomplete specification).
$t_1$=$c_1$ is an eternity.
$x_1$ is a Hawking radiation with radiate $x_2$ with radiation conditions $x_3$
quantified selbri: convert 3 to ordinal selbri; $x_{1}$ is third among $x_{2}$ ordered by rule $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is thin in direction/dimension $x_{2}$ by standard $x_{3}$; [relatively short in smallest dimension].
$x_{1}$ feels emotion $x_{2}$ (ka) about $x_{3}$.
column3: Also mood/humor (= {nuncni}).  See also cmavo list {ci'o}, {cumla}, {jilra}, {nelci}, {xendo}, {ckeji}, {cortu}, {jgira}, {kecti}, {kufra}, {manci}, {prami}, {steba}, {zungi}, {badri}, {burna}, {gleki}.

column2: $x_{1}$ (abstraction) interests/is interesting to $x_{2}$; $x_{2}$ is interested in $x_{1}$.
column3: Use $x_1$ tu'a for non-specific interest in an object; interested in (= {selci'i}).  See also {zdile}, {kucli}, {manci}, {kurji}.

column2: $x_{1}$ in activity/state $x_{2}$ exhibits sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $x_{3}$ (ka) by standard $x_{4}$.
column3: Also: $x_1$ courts/flirts; $x_3$ could be a ka[gender or role], ka[attraction to a gender], or ka[type of activity], etc.; (adjective:) $x_1$ is sexual/sexy; $x_1$ is flirted with/courted by $x_2$ (= {cinfriti}, {cinjikca}). Cf. {gletu}, {pinji}, {plibu}, {vibna}, {vlagi}.

column2: $x_{1}$ [material] is a paint of pigment/active substance $x_{2}$, in a base of $x_{3}$.
$x_{1}$ is a/are tong(s)/chopsticks/pincers/tweezers/pliers [tool/body-part] for $x_{2}$ to pinch $x_{3}$.
{cinmo} modal, 1st place                            emotionally felt by ...
$r_1$ (event/state) moistens $c_1$ with liquid $c_2$ under conditions $r_3$.
$s_1$ is a liquid consonant with place of articulation $x_2$ and phonation $x_3$.
$t_1$=$c_1$ is a swamp/marsh/wetland at location $t_2$ with liquid $c_2$
$x1$=$g1$ humidifies $x2$=$c1$ by amount/excess $x3$
$x1$ is a humidifier
$x1$=$g1$ dehumidifies $x2$=$c1$ by amount/excess $x3$
$x1$ is a dehumidifier
$n_1$=$z_1$=$x_1$ is sexually deviant/perverted in activity/state $n_2$=$x_2$ in property $z_3$=$n_3$=$x_3$ to person/by reference point $z_2$=$n_4$=$x_4$; $x1$ is sexually perverted
$ci_1$=$ct_1$ teaches audience $ct_2$ ideas/methods/lore $ct_3$ (du'u) about sexual activity/state $ci_2$=$ct_4$ by method $ct_5$ (event)
$m_1$ is a quantity of/is made of/contains oak wood/lumber from oak tree(s) of species/strain $m_2$=$c_2$.
$n_1$ is an acorn/oak nut from oak tree $n_2$=$c_1$ with shell $n_3$ and kernel $n_4$.
$c_1$=$t_1$ is a liliger of breed/variety $c_2$=$t_2$.
column3: The liliger is a hybrid cross between a male lion (Panthera leo) and a ligress (Panthera leo × Panthera tigris).

column2: $c_1$=$t_1$ is is a liger of breed/variety $c_2$=$t_2$.
column3: A liger is a hybrid cross between a male lion (Panthera leo) and a tigress (Panthera tigris).

column2: $x_1$ is August of year $x_2$ in calendar $x_3$.
$d_1$ (individual, mass) dances lion dance to accompaniment/music/rhythm $d_2$ wearing lion costume $t_1$=$c_1$.
$p_1$ is a transsexual person.
$j_1$=$c_1$ courts/flirts with $j_1$, exhibiting sexuality/gender/sexual orientation $c_3$ (ka) by standard $c_4$.
$x_1$ is sex slavery, the ownership of people for sexual purposes, according to law/custom/system $x_2$.
column3: Not necessarily by a formal system of slavery. Also connotes gendered slavery. Effectively synonymous with {glekemprezumpo'e}.

column2: $x_1$ eats/ingests/consumes insects/arthropods of species $x_2$.
column3: The eating of insects/arthropods is {cinkyzumcti}; arthropod 'meat' is '{cinkyre'u}'.

An insect- or arthropod-eater is {lo} {cinkycti}.
